diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Benign inflammatory conditions (e.g., lichen planus, psoriasis), bacterial infections, human papillomavirus infections, subungual exostoses, malignant neoplasms (e.g., squamous cell carcinoma, melanoma)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the presence of subungual hyperkeratosis and plantar scale. Laboratory confirmation was obtained through PAS staining of nail clippings, which demonstrated fungal hyphae, and a culture that grew T. rubrum.
